events.title: Birth
events.summary: Hugo Wolf was born in Windischgrätz, then part of the Austrian Empire, and spent most of his life in Vienna. His early musical talents were apparent from a young age, being taught piano and violin by his father.
events.fun_version: Hugo Wolf was born in Windischgrätz, then part of the Austrian Empire. He spent most of his life in Vienna, where the coffee is strong, and he showed his musical talents early on. His father taught him piano and violin, and by the time he was old enough for long pants, his skills were so impressive that he outshone his father, proving that the apple really doesn't fall far from the tree!

events.title: Dismissal from Vienna Conservatory
events.summary: After two years of study at the Vienna Conservatory, Hugo Wolf was dismissed for 'breach of discipline'. He claimed this was due to frustration with the school's conservative nature.
events.fun_version: Hugo Wolf attended the Vienna Conservatory for two years and was kicked out for 'breach of discipline.' Apparently, his rebellious spirit clashed with the school's conservative vibes—who knew that singing with passion could break the rules?

events.title: Death of Richard Wagner
events.summary: The death of Richard Wagner deeply affected Wolf, leading to the composition of the song 'Zur Ruh, zur Ruh', which is considered one of his best early works.
events.fun_version: When Wolf felt super inspired after Wagner's passing, he decided to channel his emotions into 'Zur Ruh, zur Ruh' – one of his best early works, a melody that says, 'Hey, I’m not ready to join the ghost club just yet!'

events.title: His first love, Vally Franck
events.summary: During his relationship with Vally Franck, who inspired him greatly, hints of Wolf's mature style in Lieder emerged. Their relationship lasted three years but ended just before his 21st birthday.
events.fun_version: During his relationship with Vally Franck, who inspired him greatly, Wolf was like a butterfly in a symphony, fluttering around with hints of his mature style in Lieder. Their relationship lasted three years but ended just before his 21st birthday.

events.title: String Quartet in D minor
events.summary: The 'String Quartet in D minor', created between 1878 and 1884, is another notable work that highlights Wolf's contributions to chamber music.
events.fun_version: The 'String Quartet in D minor' is so extraordinary that it must have been written during a lunch break when Wolf decided coffee just wasn’t enough to fuel his genius! Created between 1878 and 1884, this quartet is like a fine wine — it gets better with age. It’s one of those notable works that highlight Wolf's contributions to chamber music and try to prove that chamber music isn't just for fancy folks in tuxedos!

events.title: Penthesilea
events.summary: Wolf's symphonic poem 'Penthesilea' was composed between 1883 and 1885, illustrating his capability in orchestral music.
events.fun_version: Wolf's symphonic poem 'Penthesilea' was composed between 1883 and 1885, illustrating his capability in orchestral music.

events.title: Italian Serenade
events.summary: The 'Italian Serenade', composed in 1887 and later orchestrated in 1892, is a string quartet that illustrates Wolf's brilliance in instrumental music.
events.fun_version: The 'Italian Serenade', composed in 1887 and orchestrated in 1892, is a string quartet that crashed a party and said, "Hey, I play the strings, but I also have a few orchestral moves!" It’s a musical swagger fest where Wolf shows off his brilliance like a peacock in a tuxedo!

events.title: Resuming Composition
events.summary: After abandoning his activities as a critic, Wolf began composing again in 1887, producing songs that emphasized themes of strength and resolution under adversity.
events.fun_version: In 1887, after abandoning his activities as a critic, Wolf decided to pick up his quill and compose songs that emphasized themes of strength and resolution under adversity.

events.title: Productivity in 1888-1889
events.summary: These years marked a productive turning point in Wolf's career, during which he composed a number of remarkable songs while staying with family friends in Perchtoldsdorf.
events.fun_version: These years marked a productive turning point for Wolf – like a fine wine that aged him perfectly! He was busy composing remarkable songs while staying with family friends in Perchtoldsdorf, where he undoubtedly serenaded them nonstop. Who wouldn’t want a roommate who sings all day, especially one who’s turning out hit after hit?

events.title: Completion of the Italienisches Liederbuch
events.summary: Wolf completed the first half of the Italienisches Liederbuch, which significantly contributed to his growing fame as a composer.
events.fun_version: Wolf tackled the first half of the Italienisches Liederbuch like it was a hefty slice of pizza—savoring each note while dreaming of fame. Who knew that serenading the world could come with a side of reputation seasoning?

events.title: Spanisches Liederbuch
events.summary: In 1891, Wolf released the 'Spanisches Liederbuch', a collection of songs set to texts by Paul Heyse and Emanuel Geibel, showcasing his lyrical talents and affinity for song.
events.fun_version: In 1891, Wolf dropped the 'Spanisches Liederbuch', basically proving that he could set songs to texts by Paul Heyse and Emanuel Geibel – because who wouldn’t want to sing their grocery list? It’s like he threw a musical party and invited only the most melodious poets!

events.title: Italienisches Liederbuch
events.summary: The 'Italienisches Liederbuch', focused on texts by Paul Heyse, consists of songs that Wolf published in stages during 1892 and 1896, further establishing his reputation in the lieder genre.
events.fun_version: The 'Italienisches Liederbuch' is like assembling your emotions—written by Paul Heyse and set to music by Wolf, who decided to release his 'instructions' in pieces from 1892 to 1896, further establishing his reputation in the lieder genre. This might just be the soundtrack for your next emotional meltdown!

events.title: Der Corregidor
events.summary: Hugo Wolf composed the opera 'Der Corregidor' in 1895, which is noted as one of his significant works in the operatic genre.
events.fun_version: Hugo Wolf composed the opera 'Der Corregidor' in 1895, which is one of his significant works in the operatic genre. It’s considered his big break, somewhat like finally finding Wi-Fi in the middle of the woods.

events.title: Completion of Manuel Venegas
events.summary: Hugo Wolf completed the opera 'Manuel Venegas' but struggled with his mental health during this period, affecting his ability to compose.
events.fun_version: Hugo Wolf wrapped up his opera 'Manuel Venegas' but was battling a mental health monster that kept stealing his notes and hiding his composing inspiration.

events.title: Michelangelo Lieder
events.summary: In 1897, Wolf created the 'Michelangelo Lieder', a set of songs inspired by the texts of the renowned artist Michelangelo, reflecting his deep engagement with artistic themes.
events.fun_version: In 1897, Wolf cooked up a musical feast called the 'Michelangelo Lieder', inspired directly by the texts of the renowned artist Michelangelo. He took a pinch of Michelangelo's artistic genius, added a dash of his own flair, and served it up with a side of melodrama! Who knew songs could be a canvas too?

events.title: Asylum Admission
events.summary: Wolf was placed in a Vienna asylum at his own insistence after a mental breakdown, resulting from his long struggle with syphilitic insanity.
events.fun_version: Wolf decided to check into a Vienna asylum, because who needs a vacation when you can have a mental breakdown? After years of battling syphilitic insanity, he probably thought, "What’s a little crazy compared to a five-star experience in a padded room?"

events.title: Death
events.summary: Hugo Wolf passed away after years of mental illness, leaving behind unfinished works and a legacy as a significant composer of Lieder.
events.fun_version: Hugo Wolf expired after wrestling for years with mental illness, leaving behind a significant legacy as a maestro of Lieder and a delightful mess of unfinished compositions.

works.title: Wenn ich in deine Augen seh
Gretchen vor dem Andachtsbild der Mater dolorosa
6 Geistliche Lieder nach Gedichten von Eichendorff
Da fahr ich still im Wagen
Ich geh durch die dunklen Gassen
Musik zu Ibsens Schauspiel 'Das Fest auf Solhaug'
